page.title: 06COASTAL EROSION AT GURNARD
page.content: The Isle of Wight is suffering from coastal erosion.The cliffs are going into the sea because the waves are washing them away. The land at the bottom of the gardens in Solent View road is slipping into the sea. The landslips are caused by blue slipper clay which slips into the sea after heavy rain.On the beach by the bottom of my garden was a hut that got smashed to pieces by a storm in May this year.The land of Gurnard is washing away in a few places. Along the Marsh beach it is coming away everywhere.When the land slips, it does it gradually instead of a sheer drop. To try and stop any more slipping people have planted trees and bushes.Down on the beach we saw people had tried netting the stones to stop them being washed away by the sea.
